Unification of Germany proclaimed at Versailles, early 1871; treaty very punitive to France March–May: Paris Commune; women’s efforts to take leadership positions thwarted, many women’s rights leaders flee into exile; others are arrested and tried in military courts Period of reaction, political uncertainty, and cautious activity for women’s rights advocates until 1875
